_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

AE Polysilicon Corporation
Fairless Hills, PA 19030

This is the initial RMP Submittal for a new chemical manufacturing facility.  

Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

At this facility we manufacture ultra-pure polysilicon by reacting metallurgical grade silicon with hydrogen and silicon tetrachloride to produce trichlorosilane which is then converted into ultra-pure polysilicon.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State and Local rules and regulations.  Numerous safety devices have been designed into the facility.  Safe work practices and training of all personnel supplement the inherent safe design of the plant.

Our emergency response personnel are trained to OSHA HAZMAT standards (40 hour) and also receive industrial fire brigade, first aid and CPR, and incident command training.  Our emergency response plan includes procedures for the notification of the local Fire authority.  A detailed response plan identifies what we believe to be credible leak scenarios and actions to be taken to minimize any potential environmental or health issues.

The regulated substances handled:

The primary function of this facility is the manufacturing of ultra-high purity polysilicon.  The only material handled at the facility that is above the EHS Threshold Quantity is Trichlorosilane.

 The general accidental release prevention program and specific prevention steps:

The facility complies with the Federal EPAA?s Accidental Release Prevention Plan and OSHAA?s Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation.  The design and construction of the facility complies with applicable state and industry codes.

Five year accident history

The facility is a newly constructed facility and has had no accidents to date. 

The emergency response program:

Our emergency response personnel are trained to OSHA HAZMAT standards.  At this site, employees are trained to recognize emergencies and initiate emergency response from outside age

ncies if necessary.  They have been trained to OSHAA?s Operations Level as a minimum or as a HAZMAT Technician.  The employees will receive annual refresher training in their role in the plan.  Periodic drills will be conducted to review the effectiveness of our team and procedures.


Planned changes to improve safety

This is a new facility and is equipped with the safety measures required by all applicable laws and regulations as well as the relevant recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices.
